intro: Lachnaea marlothii, commonly known as the Marloth's lichen, is a species of crustose lichen belonging to the family Lecanoraceae. It is characterized by its dense, granular thallus that is typically pale to dark yellow in color. The lichen is often found growing on rock surfaces in arid and semi-arid regions, particularly in southern Africa. It forms a symbiotic relationship with a specific species of green algae, which contributes to its ability to survive in harsh environments. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, Lachnaea marlothii is considered a rare and specialized organism.
